documentType: FBI Electronic Communication and FD-302 Interview Reports
summary: This document set contains the FBI's initial electronic communication opening a death investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's suicide, FD-302 interview reports with BOP personnel regarding the incident and prison protocols, and multiple evidence logs detailing the seizure of surveillance system hard drives from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). It details the discovery of Epstein's body, initial findings of protocol failures, and the evidence collection process. This document is an FBI 302 interview report of a Unit Manager at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding the supervision and events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death. The interviewee details Epstein's behavior, housing assignments, suicide attempt in July 2019, the process of assigning him a cellmate, and the circumstances on the night of his death, including a phone call Epstein made. The report also includes a chain of custody log for evidence collected from Epstein's cell. This document is a daily assignment roster for correctional staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, covering August 9-10, 2019. It details post assignments, shift changes, and staff statuses (sick leave, annual leave, etc.), and includes the names of specific inmates in Special Housing Units (SHU). This document contains administrative records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York for August 10, 2019, including staff schedules, inmate counts, and Special Housing Unit (SHU) 30-minute check sheets for Tiers G through M. It also includes a series of FBI Collected Item Logs documenting the submission of cloned hard drives (evidence items 1B4 through 1B18) for forensic analysis on August 16, 2019, and the seizure of evidence from MCC cell #220 and New York Presbyterian Hospital on August 10, 2019, related to the death investigation of Jeffrey Epstein. This document set contains FBI investigative records from the death investigation of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in August 2019. It includes interviews with inmates who witnessed the events, logs of seized video evidence, and database checks on correctional officers of interest. The records detail the discovery of Epstein's death, inmate observations of guard behavior, and the collection of digital evidence from the MCC. This is a background check report on Tova Noel, generated on August 18, 2019. It compiles personal identifiers, addresses, utility services, a criminal traffic citation, a divorce case record, and lists of associates. The report appears to be part of an investigative data collection, possibly related to the Epstein case, though no direct connection to Epstein is stated in this excerpt. This document contains law enforcement database query results for Tova A. Noel, including DMV records, criminal history checks, and U.S. Customs and Border Protection travel history. The search appears to be part of an investigation (Case No. 90A-NY-3151227) into violent crime and gangs, and reveals Noel's applications for law enforcement-related jobs and her international travel patterns. This document is a collection of investigative reports and database queries from August 2019, primarily focusing on two individuals: Tova Anjanique Noel (a person of interest) and Michael A. Thomas Sr. It includes a 'Person of Interest Worksheet' for Noel detailing her background, travel, and job applications, and extensive background checks on Thomas, including his criminal history, vehicle registrations, and associates. The searches were conducted by FBI personnel in relation to case number 90A-NY-3151227. This document is a comprehensive background or financial report on an individual named Michael Thomas, generated on August 18, 2019. It compiles data from credit bureaus, utility records, civil judgments, lawsuits, vehicle registrations, and relative associations, detailing his addresses, financial debts, and legal history. The report appears to be part of an investigative or due diligence process, possibly related to the Epstein case, to profile associates or individuals of interest. This document appears to be a detailed individual report, likely a financial or background check report, on a person named Michael Thomas (or Michael A. Thomas). It lists numerous addresses, phone numbers, Social Security numbers, dates of birth, and possible aliases associated with this individual across multiple states and years, suggesting an investigation into his identity, locations, and potential associates. This document is a financial or investigative report listing numerous individuals named 'Michael Thomas' or 'Michael A Thomas' with associated Social Security Numbers, dates of birth, and extensive address histories spanning multiple decades and military locations. It appears to be a data aggregation report linking multiple individuals with the same name to various addresses, possibly for investigative purposes. This document appears to be a financial or background investigation report on an individual named Michael Thomas, generated on August 19, 2019. It compiles extensive address history, potential associates, and public record searches including court cases and a bankruptcy filing. The report includes analytics flags for criminal records, sanctions, and other checks, most returning negative results. This document is an FBI database check report and Person of Interest worksheet, dated August 22, 2019. It contains background checks on two individuals: Michael Albert Thomas and Robert Charles (last name partially redacted). The checks were performed as part of investigations into Jeffrey Epstein's death and a drug introduction at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The report includes passport info, criminal history, DMV records, vehicle registrations, and associates for the subjects. This is a U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) TECS query report generated on August 20, 2019, showing the travel encounter history for an individual named Latham. The report lists four cruise ship arrivals between 2011 and 2013, with secondary inspection details for one entry in December 2013. The document is part of law enforcement records related to the Epstein case. This document is a compilation of FBI investigative records related to the death investigation of Jeffrey Epstein. It includes a proffer interview with Omar Deleon, the collection and forensic examination of an iPhone from Michael Thomas, detailed logs of DVR hard drives seized from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), and an interview with an MCC Lieutenant regarding the circumstances of Epstein's death and prison procedures.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified as the decedent and subject of the FBI death investigation. Evidence was collected from his cell (SHU Cell #220) and personal items were transferred to the medical examiner.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: Identified as Jeffrey Epstein's next of kin, who was notified of his death by a BOP supervisor at 1100 hours on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate selected after the July incident. He was out of the cell for court on August 9, 2019, leaving Epstein alone.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate during a July 2019 incident where Epstein claimed Tartaglione tried to take his life, leading to Epstein being placed on suicide watch.

persons.name: Thomas Edge
persons.context: MCC Associate Warden who was notified of Epstein's death and to whom the interviewee provided a timeline memo.

persons.name: Noel
persons.context: Correctional Officer (CO) who guarded Epstein during a phone call on August 9 and was on watch. He appeared in a daze after Epstein's death and was subject to a welfare check.

persons.name: Davis
persons.context: Correctional Officer who reported that Epstein gave him a thumbs-up during the 10:00 p.m. stand-up count on August 9.

persons.name: Thomas
persons.context: Correctional Officer who did not report to work on August 12 and was subject to a welfare check.

persons.name: Reyes. d
persons.context: Appears as a staff member assigned to the TOOL ROOM post on the roster for August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Thomas, M
persons.context: Listed as an inmate in Special Housing Unit (SHU) #2 on the roster. Also referenced in shift change records regarding sick/annual leave for a staff member.

persons.name: Noel, T
persons.context: Listed as an inmate assigned to Special Housing Unit (SHU) #1 on the rosters for August 9 and 10, 2019.

persons.name: Davis, mS
persons.context: Appears as an inmate assigned to Special Housing Unit (SHU) #3 on the roster for August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Leathern, K
persons.context: Appears in a shift change record on August 10, 2019, noted as being on sick leave.

persons.name: Christopher Santos Felix
persons.context: Inmate interviewed on 08/16/2019 who provided details about the night of Epstein's death, including guard rounds, the discovery of the body, and Epstein's cellmate.

persons.name: Johnny Contreras
persons.role: MCC inmate, cellmate of Christopher Felix
persons.context: Described by Felix as his cellmate who also witnessed events but would not speak due to being a member of MS-13.

persons.name: Stone
persons.role: MCC inmate, cellmate of Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to by inmate Felix as Epstein's cellmate. Felix states Stone went to court on Friday, August 9, and did not return that night.

persons.name: Edward Jimenez
persons.context: Inmate (ID 79466-054) interviewed on 08/16/2019 who was housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and provided observations about guard activity and Epstein's removal on a stretcher.

persons.name: Corey Latimer
persons.context: BOP inmate (Registration 79427-054) interviewed pursuant to a Proffer Agreement on 08/19/2019. Provided information relating to the investigation (details in attached notes).

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.role: MCC correctional officer, person of interest
persons.context: MCC correctional officer who was the subject of extensive database checks (Accurint, CLEAR, DMV, etc.) as a person of potential interest in the death investigation. The report lists her addresses, vehicles, voter registration, and associates.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: The primary subject of the financial/background investigation report, with extensive address history in New Jersey, New York, and other states, and multiple civil court cases.

persons.name: Jerome Kevin Christian
persons.context: Listed as a party, specifically the other spouse, in the divorce case (NOEL-CHRISTIAN, TOVA ANJANIQUE v.) referenced in the report. He is noted as appearing pro se.

persons.name: Lorraine Martinez Ross
persons.context: Identified as the judge or authorizer in the divorce case involving Tova Noel.

persons.name: Tova A. Noel
persons.role: Subject of law enforcement database inquiry
persons.context: Individual whose DMV, criminal history, and travel records were queried by law enforcement as part of investigation 90A-NY-3151227. Records show multiple job applications to law enforcement agencies.

persons.name: Mallory Rosso
persons.role: U.S. Customs and Border Protection Officer
persons.context: FBI analyst who prepared the Person of Interest worksheet and is listed as the user who ran the PACER and other database searches included in the document.

persons.name: Michael C. Green
persons.role: Executive Deputy Commissioner of NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services
persons.context: Listed as the Executive Deputy Commissioner of the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services on the header of the criminal history response forms.

persons.name: Tova Anjanique Noel
persons.context: Subject of a 'Person of Interest Worksheet' prepared by IA Mallory Rosso. The report details her background, addresses, travel history, job applications, and lack of criminal history.

persons.name: Michael A. Thomas Sr
persons.context: Primary subject of extensive background searches (Accurint, DMV, CJIS, NCIC). The reports show his addresses, vehicle information, driver's license status with suspensions, and a potential 'Wanted Person' hit for a similar name.

persons.name: Michael A Thomas
persons.context: Listed as an alias or variant name for Michael A. Thomas Sr. in the background reports.

persons.name: Glenn T Welsh
persons.context: Appears in the address history section of the Michael Thomas background report, listed at a business address in Watertown, NY.

persons.name: Edain
persons.context: Listed as the spouse name for Michael Thomas in the background report summary.

persons.name: Michael Thamos
persons.context: A name that generated a 'Wanted Person' hit in NYS/NCIC person searches during the investigation of Michael A. Thomas, based on a name/DOB match. DOB listed as 1977-03-01.

persons.name: Fentonml
persons.context: FBI user (likely SA Michael Fenton) who received DMV inquiry responses for the Michael Thomas search.

persons.name: Joy A Thomas
persons.context: Listed as the registered owner of two vehicles (a 2005 Mercury Mountaineer and a 1995 Ford Explorer) associated with an address also linked to Michael Thomas.

persons.name: Edain Thomas
persons.context: Identified as a relative of Michael Thomas, sharing an address in Plainfield, NJ.

persons.name: James Perez
persons.context: Listed as the creditor to whom Michael Thomas owed $2,753.00 in a civil judgment filed in Union County, NJ, in 2013.

persons.name: David Lyons
persons.context: An attorney from the firm Lyons Doughty & Veldhuis, representing a party (likely a creditor) in a civil lawsuit against Michael Thomas.

persons.name: Michael A. Thomas
persons.context: Listed multiple times as a relative of the subject Michael Thomas, and appears to be connected through shared addresses and identity markers (SSN, DOB).

persons.name: Thomas, Michael
persons.context: Primary subject of the report, with multiple SSNs and DOBs listed, suggesting several individuals with the same name are being tracked. Associated with numerous addresses, many near military bases.

persons.name: Thomas, Michael A
persons.context: Variant name used throughout the report, listed with multiple SSNs issued in different states and associated with extensive address histories.

persons.name: Thomas, Alex D
persons.context: Listed as a relative of 'Michael A' with a SSN issued in Vermont and associated addresses in New York and Vermont.

persons.name: Michael Albert Thomas
persons.context: Subject of an FBI Person of Interest worksheet. The document lists his passport information, physical description, driver's license, phone numbers, email, vehicle (2016 Nissan Maxima), and notes on civil court filings. He was reported as a victim in a 2014 domestic incident.

persons.name: Ashley M Thomas
persons.context: Named in a joint Chapter 7 bankruptcy filing with Michael Albert Thomas on July 12, 2019, though the filing was in Kentucky and the SSN did not match.

persons.name: Mark Cubberley
persons.context: Named as a defendant (Mark Cubberley Esq) in a civil case (THOMAS VS CUBBERLEY ESQ MARK) from Mercer County in 1998 where Michael A Thomas was the plaintiff.

persons.name: Michelle Hallam
persons.context: Named as a defendant (Hallam Michelle) in a civil case (THOMAS VS HALLAM MICHELLE) from Atlantic County in 2014 where Michael A Thomas was the plaintiff.

persons.name: Monique Faare
persons.context: Identified as the girlfriend of Michael Albert Thomas in a domestic incident report from December 26, 2014, which involved an argument over custody.

persons.name: Robert Charles
persons.context: Primary subject of an extensive FBI database check (Accurint report). The report lists his addresses, phone numbers, vehicles, associates, criminal record checks, and protection orders. He is linked to the investigations into Jeffrey Epstein's death and MCC drug introduction.

persons.name: Adam Roberts
persons.context: Individual flagged as a 'Wanted Person' in an NCIC hit during a search related to Robert Charles. Warrant is for contempt of court/failure to comply.

persons.name: James Adam-Guevara
persons.context: Individual flagged in an NCIC record for being on federal probation or supervised release. The record instructs contacting federal probation within 24 hours of any inquiry.

persons.name: Charles Pinkney
persons.context: Listed as an associate of Robert Charles via a shared address in the Accurint report. He is noted as deceased, born in 1933.

persons.name: Latham
persons.context: Individual whose travel encounter history is being queried by CBP, showing multiple cruise ship arrivals into the United States between 2011 and 2013.

persons.name: Omar Deleon
persons.context: Interviewed at the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the investigation. His counsel was present.

persons.name: Shannon Farrar
persons.role: Associate, Law Offices of Montell Figgins
persons.context: Represented Michael Thomas and provided his iPhone and consent form to the FBI.

persons.name: Montell Figgins
persons.context: His law firm represented Michael Thomas.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.role: Bureau of Prisons Lieutenant at MCC
persons.context: Interviewed about MCC procedures, the discovery of Epstein's body, and statements from corrections officers Noel and Thomas.

persons.name: Officer Noel
persons.context: Present at Epstein's cell when he was found. Told the Lieutenant 'EPSTEIN hung himself' and admitted she and Officer Thomas did not conduct 3am and 5am rounds.

persons.name: Officer Thomas
persons.context: Attempted to administer CPR to Epstein. Admitted to not conducting rounds with Officer Noel.

persons.name: Leonardo Fernandez
persons.context: Interviewed; was housed near Epstein's cell (L-Tier) prior to Epstein's death but had no information about the death.

persons.name: Tyrelyshanti Craiag
persons.context: Visited Fernandez at MCC, after which he was suspected of receiving contraband.

events.title: Discovery of Jeffrey Epstein's Body
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was discovered unresponsive in his jail cell at the MCC with a fabricated noose around his neck in an apparent suicide. Preliminary investigation revealed protocol and technical failures.

events.title: Epstein's Last Phone Call
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein made a phone call on an unsecure 'legal line' at approximately 1900 hours, stating he was calling his mother (who is deceased). The call was not recorded in the normal BOP system.

events.title: Medical Response to Epstein
events.description: A BOP nurse/medic responded to an alarm at 0633, arrived at Epstein's cell at 0635, found guards administering CPR, detected no vitals, attempted AED shocks (unsuccessful), and Epstein was transported for further unsuccessful resuscitation efforts.

events.title: Seizure of Surveillance Evidence
events.description: FBI agents seized 18 hard drives from the MCC's NICE VISION PRO CCTV system on August 10, and later seized a DVR controller and a second DVR system on August 14 and 15 as part of the death investigation.

events.title: Epstein's First Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell with a homemade piece of fabric on his chest. He accused his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, of trying to kill him. He was placed on Suicide Watch.

events.title: Epstein's Last Day and Phone Call
events.description: Epstein met with his lawyers and, in the evening, was assisted by the Unit Manager in making a phone call to a contact (possibly his mother) from the SHU shower area. His cellmate, Reyes, was at court.

events.title: Epstein Found Deceased
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell (Cell 220, L-Tier, SHU) without a cellmate. He was pronounced dead, and an investigation into his death began.

events.title: Evidence Collection from Cell
events.description: FBI agents and other officials searched Epstein's cell and seized items including a torn sheet, miscellaneous papers, an MP-3 player, and a piece of fabric listed as a 'hand made noose'.

events.title: MCC New York Daily Staff Roster
events.description: Compilation of correctional staff assignments, shift changes, and inmate placements for the day at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York.

events.title: MCC New York Daily Staff Roster
events.description: Continuation of the daily staff assignment roster, showing posts, shift changes, and inmate assignments.

events.title: MCC Administrative Operations and Evidence Seizure
events.description: Routine administrative operations at MCC New York, including staff scheduling, inmate counts, and 30-minute checks in the Special Housing Unit (SHU). FBI agents seized evidence from SHU Cell #220, including a torn sheet, clothing from New York Presbyterian Hospital, miscellaneous papers, and an MP-3 player.

events.title: Forensic Hard Drive Cloning and Transfer to OCME
events.description: The FBI's Computer Analysis Response Team (CART-NY) created clone copies of numerous hard drives (evidence items 1B4-1B18). Separately, items 1B37 and 1B38 (bedding and clothing) were transferred to the NYC Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (OCME) for examination.

events.title: Submission of CART Derivative Evidence
events.description: FBI documented the formal submission of cloned hard drive evidence (NYC027704 through NYC027715) to the case file for the Jeffrey Epstein death investigation.

events.title: Night before Epstein's death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was taken down to legal visits in the morning and returned in the evening. His cellmate 'Stone' went to court and did not return. Inmates observed guard rounds.

events.title: Discovery of Jeffrey Epstein's death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The discovery was made during breakfast and head count. A male guard performed CPR, and EMS removed the body.

events.title: Seizure of video evidence from MCC
events.description: FBI collected a 500GB hard drive containing video downloaded from DVR1 at MCC, including footage from the Special Housing Unit (floor 9) and Attorney Visit area (floor 3) from July 23 to August 10, 2019.

events.title: Interviews of inmates Felix and Jimenez
events.description: FBI and OIG agents interviewed MCC inmates Christopher Santos Felix and Edward Jimenez regarding their observations of the events surrounding Epstein's death.

events.title: Proffer interview of inmate Corey Latimer
events.description: Corey Latimer was interviewed pursuant to a Proffer Agreement at the SDNY, with AUSA and FBI/OIG agents present, providing information related to the investigation.

events.title: Database checks on persons of interest
events.description: FBI performed database checks (Accurint, CLEAR, DMV, TECS, PACER) on persons of potential interest, specifically correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas.

events.title: Traffic arrest of Tova Noel
events.description: Tova Noel was arrested for 'Driving vehicle at greater speed than is reasonable under conditions' in Barnwell County, SC. The case was disposed with a forfeiture.

events.title: Divorce case filing
events.description: A divorce case (NOEL-CHRISTIAN, TOVA ANJANIQUE v.) was filed in Bronx Supreme Court, New York. The case was uncontested and disposed by March 2013.

events.title: Tova Noel returns to JFK from Beijing
events.description: Tova A. Noel encountered by U.S. Customs and Border Protection at JFK Airport Terminal 1 after arriving on Air China flight 981 from Beijing.

events.title: U.S. Passport issued to Tova Noel
events.description: U.S. Passport issued to Tova A. Noel, expiring November 15, 2028.

events.title: Law enforcement database query on Tova Noel
events.description: Comprehensive law enforcement database query conducted on Tova A. Noel, including DMV, criminal history, and CBP records as part of investigation 90A-NY-3151227.

events.title: Tova Noel Returns from Beijing
events.description: Tova Noel returned from a trip on a flight from Beijing to JFK, noted as her most recent international travel.

events.title: Noel Divorce Finalized
events.description: Tova Noel divorced her husband, Jerome Kevin Christian, in 2013.

events.title: Thomas Driver's License Suspension
events.description: Michael A. Thomas's driver's license was suspended for failure to pay a driver responsibility assessment.

events.title: Thomas Driver's License Suspension
events.description: Michael A. Thomas's driver's license was suspended for failure to answer a summons.

events.title: Thomas Driver's License Suspension
events.description: Michael A. Thomas's driver's license was suspended for failure to pay a fine.

events.title: Investigative Database Queries
events.description: FBI personnel conducted multiple database searches (Pacer, CLEAR, TECS, DMV, NCIC) on Tova Noel and Michael Thomas as part of case 90A-NY-3151227.

events.title: Arrest of Michael Thomas
events.description: Michael Thomas was arrested and booked by the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office. He was released from supervision on May 19, 2001.

events.title: Civil Judgment for James Perez
events.description: A civil judgment was filed against Michael Thomas in Union County, NJ, in favor of James Perez for $2,753.00.

events.title: Civil Judgment for Cavalry Portfolio
events.description: A civil judgment was filed against Michael Thomas in Union County, NJ, in favor of Cavalry Portfolio Service LLC for $1,879.00.

events.title: Civil Judgment for Capital One Bank
events.description: A civil judgment was filed against Michael Thomas in Union County, NJ, in favor of Capital One Bank USA for $1,854.00.

events.title: Civil Judgment for Palisades Collection
events.description: A civil judgment was filed against Michael Thomas in Essex County, NJ, in favor of Palisades Collection Ltd. Liability for $819.00.

events.title: Bankruptcy Filing
events.description: Michael Albert Thomas and Ashley M Thomas file for bankruptcy in the Kentucky Western Bankruptcy Court (Case 2019bk32194).

events.title: Report Generation
events.description: The comprehensive background/financial investigation report on Michael Thomas is generated.

events.title: Civil Lawsuit Filed
events.description: Michael A Thomas files a civil lawsuit against Mark Cubberley Esq (Case SC-001573-98).

events.title: Civil Lawsuit Filed
events.description: Michael A Thomas files a civil lawsuit against Michelle Hallam (Case SC-001554-14).

events.title: Domestic Incident Involving Michael Thomas
events.description: NYPD report of a domestic incident where Michael Albert Thomas was the victim in an argument over custody with his girlfriend, Monique Faare.

events.title: Joint Bankruptcy Filing
events.description: Michael Albert Thomas and Ashley M Thomas filed a joint Chapter 7 bankruptcy petition in Kentucky.

events.title: FBI Database Checks Performed
events.description: FBI analyst Mallory Rosso performed comprehensive database checks on Michael Albert Thomas and Robert Charles as part of the Epstein death and MCC drug introduction investigations.

events.title: Protection Order Against Robert Charles
events.description: An NCIC temporary protection order was issued against Robert Charles, prohibiting contact with a protected person and firearm possession.

events.title: Cruise Ship Arrival - Secondary Inspection
events.description: Latham arrived in the United States via cruise ship and was referred for secondary inspection. The report indicates a passport was presented, but the document number is redacted.

events.title: Cruise Ship Arrival
events.description: Latham arrived in the United States via cruise ship. Status was 'NOT REFERRED' for secondary inspection.

events.title: Cruise Ship Arrival
events.description: Latham arrived in the United States via cruise ship. Status was 'NOT REFERRED' for secondary inspection.

events.title: Cruise Ship Arrival
events.description: Latham arrived in the United States via cruise ship. Status was 'NOT REFERRED' for secondary inspection.

events.title: Proffer Interview of Omar Deleon
events.description: Omar Deleon was interviewed pursuant to a Proffer Agreement at the U.S. Attorney's Office in New York.

events.title: Seizure of Michael Thomas's iPhone
events.description: An Apple iPhone XS belonging to Michael Thomas was voluntarily provided to the FBI by his attorney's associate, Shannon Farrar, after Thomas signed a consent form.

events.title: Seizure of MCC Surveillance DVR Systems
events.description: FBI and NYPD seized multiple DVR systems and hard drives from the MCC containing surveillance footage, including from the system covering Epstein's unit.

events.title: Interview of MCC Lieutenant
events.description: An MCC Lieutenant was interviewed regarding prison procedures, the discovery of Epstein's body, and admissions from corrections officers about failure to conduct rounds.

events.title: Interview of Inmate Leonardo Fernandez
events.description: Inmate Leonardo Fernandez was interviewed; he was housed near Epstein but had no information about his death.

events.title: Forensic Extraction of iPhone
events.description: The FBI's CART performed a file system extraction on Michael Thomas's iPhone using GrayKey.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his MCC jail cell on August 10, 2019, with a fabricated noose in an apparent suicide, prompting a death investigation.
Preliminary investigation revealed 'a series of protocol failures by MCC personnel, as well as technical failures/deficiencies within the MCC.'
Epstein's last phone call was made on an unrecorded 'legal line' on August 9, where he claimed to be calling his deceased mother.
Epstein had no recorded visitors to the MCC and no authorized persons on his call log, but had $5,566.27 in his commissary account at death.
The FBI seized extensive surveillance system hardware, including 18 hard drives and complete DVR systems, from the MCC as evidence.
Epstein was placed on Suicide Watch after a July 23, 2019 incident where he was found unresponsive and accused his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, of trying to kill him.
Following the July incident, the Warden directed that Epstein must have a cellmate at all times. Efrain Reyes was selected as his cellmate.
On August 9, 2019, Epstein's cellmate, Reyes, was at court, leaving Epstein alone in his cell, contrary to the directive.
Epstein made a phone call at approximately 7:00 PM on August 9, 2019, with the assistance of a Unit Manager. He appeared happy after the call.

Epstein was found deceased in his cell on the morning of August 10, 2019. Security camera systems in the SHU were reportedly down at the time, and 30-minute rounds and inmate counts were not properly completed or documented that night.
This document is a detailed staff assignment roster for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York for August 9-10, 2019.
It lists specific inmates housed in Special Housing Units (SHU), including 'Noel, T' in SHU #1, 'Thomas, M' in SHU #2, and 'Davis, mS' in SHU #3.
The roster tracks staff statuses such as Sick Leave, Annual Leave, and AWOL, and documents numerous shift changes and post reassignments.
The document provides operational insight into the staffing and inmate management at the facility during this period.
The document provides a detailed snapshot of MCC New York's operations on August 10, 2019, including staff schedules and mandatory 30-minute inmate checks in the Special Housing Unit.
FBI evidence logs confirm the seizure of items from Jeffrey Epstein's cell (SHU Cell #220) on August 10, 2019, including a torn sheet, clothing, papers, and an MP-3 player.
The FBI conducted extensive digital evidence collection, creating forensic clones of at least 15 hard drives (1B4-1B18) on August 12, 2019.
Physical evidence (bedding and clothing) was transferred to the NYC Medical Examiner's office on August 12, 2019, for examination related to Epstein's death.
The administrative records and evidence logs are contemporaneous with Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death, forming part of the official investigation record.
Inmate Christopher Felix stated guards did not perform proper rounds/checks the night Epstein died, with the last check between 12:30 AM - 1:00 AM.
Felix observed that when Epstein's body was removed, the rope was not over his head, he had bruising on his face, and earphones were still in place.
Inmate Edward Jimenez recalled hearing a male voice saying "breathe" around 6 AM on August 10 and stated Epstein's cellmate was not in the cell that night.
Extensive video evidence was collected from MCC, including footage from the Special Housing Unit and Attorney Visit areas from July 23 to August 10, 2019.

The FBI was conducting database checks on individuals (Michael Albert Thomas and Robert Charles) in August 2019 as part of the investigations into Jeffrey Epstein's death and a drug introduction at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

Robert Charles was the subject of an extensive Accurint report showing multiple addresses, vehicles, associates, and past protection orders, but no significant criminal history in the databases checked.
Michael Albert Thomas was listed as a victim in a 2014 NYPD domestic incident and had a joint bankruptcy filing in 2019, but also showed no significant criminal history.

Latham had four recorded arrivals into the United States via cruise ship between August 2011 and December 2013.
On December 29, 2013, Latham was referred for a secondary inspection upon arrival, while the other three entries were not referred.

Corrections Officers Noel and Thomas admitted to the MCC Lieutenant that they did not conduct the mandatory 3:00am and 5:00am rounds on the night Jeffrey Epstein was found dead.
The Lieutenant stated that MCC policy requires inmates on suicide watch or psychological observation to have a cellmate ('bunkie'), but Epstein did not have one at the time of his death.
Extensive digital evidence was seized from the MCC, including 18 hard drives from a DVR system and the complete DVR systems themselves, for forensic examination related to Epstein's death.
Michael Thomas voluntarily consented to a search of his Apple iPhone XS, which was unlocked and provided to the FBI by his attorney's associate, Shannon Farrar.
